names.english: invigorate the blood, break up stasis and scatter knots formula
names.commonEnglish: Invigorate the Blood, Break up Stasis and Scatter Knots Formula

actions: Invigorates Blood circulation, dispels Blood Stasis, regulates Qi, dissolves accumulations and alleviates pain.

With San Leng, for Qi and Blood Stagnation with clumping and accumulation leading to pain with distending pain in the chest, epigastrium and abdomen, amenorrhea, dysmenorrhea, uterine myoma and ovarian cysts.
Forcefully breaks up Blood Stasis, regulates Qi, dissolves accumulations, regulates menstruation. and alleviates pain.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Promotes the movement of Qi, reduces distention and pressure and resolves hardenings.
Clears Hot Phlegm and dissipates nodules.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and unblocks the menses.
Warms and facilitates the flow of Qi through the channels and collaterals and Blood through the vessels to relieve pain.
With Zhi Ke, for stabbing pain in the chest and flanks.
With Dang Gui and Chuan Xiong, for irregular menstruation due to Yang Deficiency with Cold Stagnation.
Breaks up Blood Stasis, invigorates Blood circulation and drains abscesses.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat, cools the Blood, reduces swelling and relieves pain.
With Chuan Xiong and Dang Gui, for Blood-Stasis induced gynecological disorders such as immobile abdominal masses and amenorrhea with abdominal pain.
With Tao Ren, for Blood Stasis induced menstrual disorders, especially those characterized by early period, excessive bleeding, and thick purple clots.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, reduces swelling, expels pus and alleviates pain.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and reduces abscesses.
Softens hardness and dissipates nodules.
Activates the Blood
Breaks up Stasis
Circulates Qi
syndromes: Qi, Phlegm and Blood Stagnation with Blood Stagnation predominant

symptoms: Sides and ribs distended on both sides (maybe with sharp pain)
Enlargement of the Liver and Spleen
Breast distention and pain before and during menses
Thirst with no desire to drink
manifestations.tongue: Varies from Normal to Dark purple (maybe purple spots on edge of tongue)
manifestations.pulse: Wiry, choppy and slow or Slippery, full and maybe wiry
